text:
Collections for Charities (Approved Organisations) Order (No. 2) 2002

I, the Governor in and over the State of Tasmania and its Dependencies in the Commonwealth of Australia, acting with the advice of the Executive Council, make the following order-in-council under section 5(2)(b) of the Collections for Charities Act 2001 .

16 December 2002

G. S. M. GREEN

Governor

By His Excellency's Command,

JUDY JACKSON

Minister for Justice and Industrial Relations

1. Short title
    This order-in-council may be cited as the Collections for Charities (Approved Organisations) Order (No. 2) 2002 .

2. Commencement
    This order-in-council takes effect on the day on which its making is notified in the Gazette.

3. Approved organisations
    The organisations specified in Schedule 1 are approved for the purposes of the Collections for Charities Act 2001 .

SCHEDULE 1 - Approved organisations

Clause 3

1.  Aceh Humanitarian Assistance Fund  2.  Andrew Shaw Foundation  3.  Autism Tasmania  4.  Avoca Volunteer Ambulance Group  5.  Coastal East Timor Support Group  6.  East Ulverstone Primary School Parents and Friends Association  7.  Eliza Purton Home for the Aged  8.  Emmerton Park Hostel Auxiliary  9.  Hobart Legacy  10.  Lillian Martin Home Auxiliary  11.  Lions Clubs International District 201 TI (Tasmania)  12.  Meercroft Home for the Aged Auxiliary  13.  Melaleuca Home for the Aged  14.  Menzies Centre for Population Health Research  15.  Mersey River Branch of the ALP  16.  New Norfolk Hospital Auxiliary  17.  Noise (Tas)  18.  North West Charity Trust  19.  St Vincent's Hospital Launceston  20.  Strathcare and Strathglen Aged Care  21.  Tasmanian Council of Churches
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 


Displayed and numbered in accordance with the Rules Publication Act 1953.

Notified in the Gazette on 25 December 2002

This order is administered in the Department of Justice and Industrial Relations.
